quoteLast: , J. T. Maston and his companions had reached the bottom of the Pacific; but they saw nothing but an arid desert, no longer animated by either fauna or flora. By the light of their lamps, furnished with powerful reflectors, they could see the dark beds of the ocean for a considerable extent of view, but the projectile was nowhere to be seen.
title: From the Earth to the Moon; and, Round the Moon
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteLast: , J. T. Maston and his companions had reached the bottom of the Pacific; but they saw nothing but an arid desert, no longer animated by either fauna or flora. By the light of their lamps, furnished with powerful reflectors, they could see the dark beds of the ocean for a considerable extent of view, but the projectile was nowhere to be seen.
title: From the Earth to the Moon, Direct in Ninety-Seven Hours and Twenty Minutes: and a Trip Round It
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905; Hildibrand, Henri Théophile, 1824-1897 [Engraver]; Bayard, Émile Antoine, 1837-1891 [Illustrator]; Neuville, Alphonse Marie de, 1835-1885 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: "I only know that she used to go every Tuesday and Thursday by the
quoteLast: train from Baker-St., and be back by six o'clock, so it couldn't have been very far. 'Pon my word, sometimes she'd go half crazy over that child.
title: The Late Tenant
author: Tracy, Louis, 1863-1928

quoteFirst: "Good-afternoon," she said, entering. "Do you mean to say you aren't dressed? It's quarter--no,
quoteLast: ! I make it a point to have myself and my house in perfect order every day at half-past one--Elvira understands that I demand that of her."
title: The Little Grey House
author: Taggart, Marion Ames, 1866-1945

quoteLast: of the clock, the Melford town-hall clock, and visitors are beginning to arrive pretty thickly; three or four barouches, seven or eight waggonettes, and nine or ten pony-carriages, are trotting and walking and crawling up the steep Melford street.
title: Red as a Rose is She: A Novel
author: Broughton, Rhoda, 1840-1920

quoteFirst: | Virginian hears 2 v's signaled faintly |               |   in spark similar to Titanic's, probably |               |   adjusting spark. |               | 12.27 a. m.|
quoteLast: | Virginian hears Titanic call CQ, but unable |               |   to read him. Titanic's signals end very |               |   abruptly, as power suddenly switched off.
title: Loss of the Steamship "Titanic"
author: Great Britain. Court to investigate loss of steamship "Titanic"

quoteLast: ,” said he, solemnly. And then, as if some fresh thought had just occurred to him, asked, “Where 's Tom? I never saw him this morning.”
title: Barrington. Volume 1 (of 2)
author: Lever, Charles James, 1806-1872; Browne, Hablot Knight, 1815-1882 [Illustrator]
